overview: Alleppey, also known as Alappuzha, is a municipality and town on the Laccadive Sea in Kerala, India. It is the district headquarters of Alappuzha district and is famed for its extensive waterways, backwaters and houseboats, earning it the nickname “Venice of the East”. The town has historic links to spice trade, coir manufacturing and hosts the annual Nehru Trophy Boat Race during Onam.
bestTimeToVisit: October to March (dry and pleasant weather)
idealDuration: 2–3 days to explore the backwaters, beaches and main sights
topAttractions: Our Lady of Mount Carmel Cathedral
travelTips: Travel by local ferries or houseboats for authentic backwater experience
Dress modestly when visiting temples and remove shoes where required
Try local Kerala cuisine such as appam and fish curry at budget eateries
Use public buses or auto‑rickshaws for short distances to keep costs low
Carry sufficient cash in INR as small vendors may not accept cards
Avoid the monsoon months (June‑September) if you prefer dry conditions
